private_information: I am one of two manipulators that can pick, putdown, stack, and unstack blocks.
I can observe and report the local effects of actions I execute or see executed by my partner.
manipulator1.goal: Execute and report the observed block moves from the provided action trace and keep a consistent local view of the world.

private_information: I am the other manipulator capable of moving blocks according to BlocksWorld rules.
I can observe and report the local effects of actions I execute or see executed by my partner.
manipulator2.goal: Execute and report the observed block moves from the provided action trace and keep a consistent local view of the world.

private_information: I coordinate the two manipulators and integrate their observations into a single global state.
I must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted for the FastDownwards planner encoding the initial state and the computed final arrangement as the goal.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate observations and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that represents the initial BlocksWorld instance and the derived final arrangement of the blocks.

public_information: BlocksWorld domain with standard rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved, only one block can be carried at a time, legal actions include pickup, putdown, unstack, and stack.
Blocks present: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N.
Stack1: F, N, A, E, H, J (F on table, N on F, A on N, E on A, H on E, J on H).
Stack2: G, M, B, C, I, L, D, K (G on table, M on G, B on M, C on B, I on C, L on I, D on L, K on D).

The recorded action trace executed by the agents in order is: unstack(K,D), stack(K,D), unstack(K,D), putdown(K), unstack(J,H), stack(J,D), unstack(J,D), stack(J,K), unstack(H,E), putdown(H), unstack(J,K), stack(J,H), unstack(D,L), putdown(D), unstack(L,I), stack(L,I), unstack(J,H), stack(J,D), unstack(L,I), putdown(L), pickup(L), stack(L,E), unstack(I,C), stack(I,L), pickup(H), stack(H,J), unstack(I,L), stack(I,H), unstack(C,B), stack(C,L), unstack(B,M), stack(B,K), unstack(M,G), stack(M,G), unstack(B,K), stack(B,K), unstack(M,G), stack(M,G), unstack(I,H), stack(I,B), unstack(I,B), stack(I,M), unstack(C,L), putdown(C), unstack(B,K), stack(B,L), unstack(H,J), stack(H,B), unstack(J,D), stack(J,K).

observe.system_prompt: You are manipulator1, an agent that can move blocks and report the local effects of actions you perform or observe. You must maintain a consistent local representation of the stacks you touch and emit concise observations describing each executed action and its immediate outcome.
observe.prompt: You are manipulator1. You have the following public information: BlocksWorld rules and the initial arrangement described in the environment. You also have the following private knowledge: {agents->manipulator1->private_information}. Your task is to read the provided ordered action trace and, for each action you are assigned to execute, return a short observation that states the action and the resulting local change in the stacks you touch. Do not output PDDL. Produce only observations that the orchestrator will later consume.

observe.system_prompt: You are manipulator2, an agent that can move blocks and report the local effects of actions you perform or observe. You must maintain a consistent local representation of the stacks you touch and emit concise observations describing each executed action and its immediate outcome.
observe.prompt: You are manipulator2. You have the following public information: BlocksWorld rules and the initial arrangement described in the environment. You also have the following private knowledge: {agents->manipulator2->private_information}. Your task is to read the provided ordered action trace and, for each action you are assigned to execute, return a short observation that states the action and the resulting local change in the stacks you touch. Do not output PDDL. Produce only observations that the orchestrator will later consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your responsibility is to integrate observations from the manipulators, build a single consistent global state, compute the final arrangement resulting from the provided action trace, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem pair targeted to the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions of multiple agents distinct when relevant.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Input files contain the manipulators' concise observations of the executed action trace: {pddl_orchestrator->input}. Use the initial arrangement given in the public information and the full ordered action trace to compute the final arrangement of every block. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. The PDDL problem must encode the initial state (as given) and the goal state equal to the derived final arrangement. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. If the manipulators' observations are partial, reconcile them using the public initial arrangement and the action trace. Ensure the PDDL is syntactically compatible with FastDownwards and that agent actions are kept distinct if multiple-agent actions are represented.
